title: Christian Pulisic admits to feeling under added pressure as an American playing in Europe
text:
Christian Pulisic has confessed he is feeling the pressure of being an American playing in Europe following his difficult start to life at Chelsea.

The 21-year-old arrived from Borussia Dortmund with big expectations but has so far struggled to make his mark in Frank Lampard's young side.

That expectation has seemingly weighed heavy on Pulisic's shoulders, given many expected him to step up and help fill the void left by Eden Hazard.

Christian Pulisic admits he feels under extra pressure as an American player in Europe

'It makes you feel really good at the beginning to be honest, you feel great, you see all these things, people talking about you on social media; "wow this kid is great, he's special, he's playing, he's scoring goals at 17 or 18 years old for his national team, he's playing for Dortmund in Europe,"' he told the Players' Tribune.

'You feel really great and then it's more just pressure you feel like all the stuff is kind of hitting you, and you start being expected to do all of these things.

'This generation can be tough, for young players especially, having people talk about you, having constant pressure on your back.

The 21-year-old struggles for game-time in the Premier League and last started on August 31

'Especially as Americans, we haven't had a lot of top international talents throughout our years. If you're not able to tune it out then it can be a weight on your shoulders.'

Pulisic has found himself out of the side for Premier League matches, last starting in the league back on August 31.

Mason Mount has cemented himself in the midfield, while Callum Hudson-Odoi is back fit and becomes another option in wide areas.

Pulisic has seven appearances in a Chelsea shirt and is yet to score his first competitive goal for the club.

Many believe he will take time to adapt to a new league and a new style of football but that he can go on to show his talents under Lampard.

He will look to play a role this weekend following the conclusion of the international break as Newcastle visit Stamford Bridge, having upset Manchester United 1-0 last time out.
description: The 21-year-old arrived from Borussia Dortmund with big expectations but has so far struggled to make his mark in Frank Lampard's young side and he admits to feeling the weight of expectation.
